etomica.data

Class DataLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.data.DataProcessor
      • etomica.data.DataLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataPipe, IDataSink, IListener, java.io.Serializable

    public class DataLogger
extends DataProcessor
implements IListener, java.io.Serializable
    DataSink that manages a FileWriter and also listens to non-interval integrator events and sends appropriate data to a DataWriter.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  DataLogger.DataWriter
      Interface for a DataSink that actually writes data to a file

      • processDataInfo

        public IEtomicaDataInfo processDataInfo(IEtomicaDataInfo newDataInfo)
        Description copied from class: DataProcessor
        Informs this DataProcessor of the DataInfo for the Data it will be processing. Typically the subclass will use this information to make any objects or otherwise prepare for calls to processData.
        Specified by:
        processDataInfo in class DataProcessor
        Parameters:
        newDataInfo - the DataInfo of the Data that will be input to this DataProcessor
        Returns:
        the DataInfo of the Data that will be output by this DataProcessor

      • getDataCaster

        public DataPipe getDataCaster(IEtomicaDataInfo incomingDataInfo)
        Description copied from interface: IDataSink
        Returns a DataProcessor that casts the data that will be given to this DataSink to a form that it can accept. Returns null if the Data is acceptable without casting. Otherwise object that is pushing the Data into this DataSink is responsible for filtering the Data through the returned DataTransformer.
        Specified by:
        getDataCaster in interface IDataSink
        Parameters:
        incomingDataInfo - the DataInfo for the Data that will fed to the sink's putData method
